      static Color Color.bitAnd​(Color a, Color b, Color target)
      Converts two colors to integers, performs the bitwise AND operation on them, then converts them back to colors.
      static Color Color.bitNot​(Color a, Color target)
      Converts a color to an integer, performs the bitwise NOT operation on it, then converts them back to colors.
      static Color Color.bitOr​(Color a, Color b, Color target)
      Converts two colors to integers, performs the bitwise OR operation (inclusive or) on them, then converts them back to colors.
      static Color Color.bitShiftLeft​(Color a, int places, Color target)
      Converts a color to an integer, performs a bitwise left shift operation, then converts it back to a color.
      static Color Color.bitShiftRight​(Color a, int places, Color target)
      Converts a color to an integer, performs a bitwise right shift operation, then converts it back to a color.
      static Color Color.bitShiftRightUnsigned​(Color a, int places, Color target)
      Converts a color to an integer, performs an unsigned bitwise right shift operation, then converts it back to a color.
      static Color Color.bitXor​(Color a, Color b, Color target)
      Converts two colors to integers, performs the bitwise XOR operation (exclusive or) on them, then converts them back to colors.
      static Color Color.black​(Color target)
      Returns the color black, ( 0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0 ) .
      static Color Color.blue​(Color target)
      Returns the color blue, ( 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0 ) .

      Clamps a color to a lower- and upper-bound.
      static Color Color.clamp01​(Color a, Color target)
      Ensures that the values of the color are clamped to the range [0, 1].
      static Color Color.clearBlack​(Color target)
      Returns the color clear black, ( 0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 ) .
      static Color Color.clearWhite​(Color target)
      Returns the color clear white, ( 1.0, 1.0, 1.0, 0.0 ) .

      Returns a Java-friendly representation of the color as a hexadecimal code, preceded by a '0x', in the format AARRGGBB.

      Returns a web-friendly representation of the color as a hexadecimal code, preceded by a hashtag, '#', with no alpha.
